name: plastic granulate production, unspecified, recycled, informal sector | plastic granulate, unspecified, recycled | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20134/documentation

New Delhi informal plastic recycling market is South Asia's largest recycling hub. The raw material is collected from all parts of the country. The informal sector works on its large collection network of ragpickers and kabbadiwalas present throughout the country. It is known to be one of the most efficient collection channels due to its reach to every household in the country and efficient sorting techniques. The data set is a representation of collection of raw materials from the first immediate collection point which is Tikkrikalan, situated approximately 10 kilometers from the recycling hub. The informal sector in India uses extrusion machines for granulation, and separate moulding machines for moulding and colouring of plastics from e-waste. Electricity is obtained from the grid. Certain units that do not have a connection to the grid use generator sets with diesel as fuel in it. The basic operation of granulation at all informal recycler is same. Plastic flakes are fed into the extrusion machine through hoppers and plastic in molten state pass through electrically heated barrels and passed through dye to take up a shape of wire. These are passed through the water bath to reduce its temperature and at the end of bath these wires are cut in the uniform size to produce granules. 

This dataset include activities that occur after the shredded or ground plastic material is received for pelletization.

This dataset includes activities until the received shredded or ground waste plastics is pelletized, moulded and/or coloured.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The recycling sector has been following this method for several years. There is no anticipated change in the next few years in their method of working. However, with the new e-waste rules in the country, certain changes are expected to occur over a period of time, however, may not be earlier than 2022.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The geography included for the informal sector mainly includes the recycling hub at New Delhi. However, since country's majority of the recycling happens in this hub, the data set can be considered complete.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The informal sector uses equipment that it has been utilizing for several years. The equipment are generally assembled ones and do not refer to any particular supplier. Hence it can be considered as an old technology.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The geography included for the informal sector mainly includes the recycling hub at New Delhi. However, since country's majority of the recycling happens in this hub, the data set can be considered complete.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: An initial data collection questionnaire was circulated amongst the recyclers. On-site visits were carried out and data were collected from 15 different recyclers in the informal recycling sector. Information provided was verified.  For those facilities in the informal sector that did not have documented electricity bills, electrical consumption readings were taken for major energy consuming equipment. These recyclers were engaged into recycling of plastics mainly Polycarbonate (PC), High Impact Polystyrene (HIPS), Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene (ABS), Polypropylene (PP) etc. Data collected from different recyclers was compiled in the excel sheets and analysed All the data were aggregated to per 1000 kgs of production of pellets/granules

exchanges.description: Recyled plastic granules produced from the extrusion process

flow.name: plastic granulate, unspecified, recycled
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/383:Materials recovery/3830:Materials recovery

exchanges.description: Includes power required for extruder and other auxiliary requirement including power consumed by the borewell pump. The value is calculated based on specific energy numbers of some of the imported machine (350 - 500 kWh/ton) and locally manufactured extruder machines (150 - 200 kWh/ton), and on the actual measurements. Weighted average of the numbers has been worked out. The weighted averages are calculated assuming 30% weightage on actual measurement, 30% weightage of extruders are basic, locally manufactured while 40% are imported ones. The value was calculated as a weighted average due to lack of information. The value is based on discussions with experts and recyclers as well as literature.
